adjective.description: Of the order of a millimetre in length or thickness; relating to or employing electromagnetic radiation having a wavelength of 1 to 10 millimetres; measured or expressed in millimetres.
Generally. As small as a millimetre (in figurative contexts); (of a distinction) very fine; (of accuracy) extreme. rare.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Appletons' Journal. From millimetre + -ic, after metric.
